definitions.definition: A way used for travelling between places, originally one wide enough to allow foot passengers and horses to travel, now (US) usually one surfaced with asphalt or concrete and designed to accommodate many vehicles travelling in both directions. In the UK both senses are heard: a country road is the same as a country lane .
Roads in general as a means of travel, especially by motor vehicle .
examples: We travelled to the seaside by road .

definitions.definition: A path chosen, as in life or career .
examples: the road to happiness; the road to success.

definitions.definition: An underground tunnel in a mine .
A railway or ( UK , rail transport ) a single railway track.
The act of riding on horseback .
A hostile ride against a particular area; a raid .
A partly sheltered area of water near a shore in which vessels may ride at anchor ; a roadstead .
A journey, or stage of a journey.
A hard , flat pitch , typically favourable for batters .

main_definition: A way used for travelling between places, originally one wide enough to allow foot passengers and horses to travel, now (US) usually one surfaced with asphalt or concrete and designed to accommodate many vehicles travelling in both directions. In the UK both senses are heard: a country road is the same as a country lane . [from 16th c.]
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Roads in general as a means of travel, especially by motor vehicle .
( dated ) A physical way or route.
( figuratively ) A path chosen, as in life or career . [from 17th c.]
An underground tunnel in a mine . [from 18th c.]
( US , rail transport ) A railway or ( UK , rail transport ) a single railway track. [from 19th c.]
( obsolete ) The act of riding on horseback . [9th–17th c.]
( obsolete ) A hostile ride against a particular area; a raid . [9th–19th c.]
( nautical , usually in the plural ) A partly sheltered area of water near a shore in which vessels may ride at anchor ; a roadstead . [from 14th c.]
( obsolete ) A journey, or stage of a journey.
( cricket ) A hard , flat pitch , typically favourable for batters .
